title: Invalid suggestion when trying to use a reference in the loop
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code. BTW.  (As a Rust novice I tried to get multiple copies of mutable reference)

```rust
 fn baz(_s: &mut String) {
        // do something
    }
    
    fn main() {
        let bar: &'static mut String = Box::leak(Box::new("test".to_string()));
        loop {
            tokio::spawn(async move {
                baz(bar);
            });
            
            // some conditions here to exit from the loop
        }
    }
```

The rust compiler told me about the problem, but a suggestion was syntactically incorrect (won't compile)

The error and suggestion

```
error[[E0382]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/error-index.html#E0382): use of moved value: `bar`
  [--> src/main.rs:8:37
](https://play.rust-lang.org/#)   |
6  |           let bar: &'static mut String = Box::leak(Box::new("test".to_string()));
   |               --- move occurs because `bar` has type `&mut String`, which does not implement the `Copy` trait
7  |           loop {
8  |               tokio::spawn(async move {
   |  _____________________________________^
9  | |                 baz(bar);
   | |                     --- use occurs due to use in generator
10 | |             });
   | |_____________^ value moved here, in previous iteration of loop
   |
help: consider creating a fresh reborrow of `bar` here
   |
8  |             tokio::spawn(async move &mut *{
   |                                     ++++++
```
I

### Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:

rustc 1.60.0 (7737e0b5c 2022-04-04)
